SampleCoordinateUnit: normalized 2d image space (image width/height). Bounds = x: [0, 1], y: [0, 1]; center = (0.5, 0.5)
ScreenSize: TODO: insert screen size in m, excluding screen borders
ScreenDistance: TODO: I estimated the distance to ~4164 pixels based on basic trigo and the screen's dim in deg of visual angle. But they probably want it in meters? https://bids-specification--1128.org.readthedocs.build/en/1128/modality-specific-files/eye-tracking.html#sidecar-json-document-_eyetrackjson
ScreenRefreshRate: TODO: refresh rate of screen in Hz; 60 fps?
Manufacturer: TODO: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the measurements
SoftwareVersions: TODO: Manufacturer's designation of software version
DeviceSerialNumber: TODO (optional): The serial number of the equipment that produced the measurements. can use pseudonym
MaximalCalibrationError: TODO (optional): Maximal calibration error in degree
AverageCalibrationError: TODO (optional): Average calibration error in visual degree; i don't think we have that
EyeCameraSettings: TODO (optional): any settings that influence the resolution and quality of the eye imagery. Autowhitebalance? Changes in sharpness?
FeatureDetectionSettings: TODO (optional): A place to store arbitrary information related to feature detection. For example Minimum/maximum pupil size.
GazeMappingSettings: TODO (optional): A place to store arbitrary information related to gaze mapping. For example, if there was a threshold on pupil confidence REQUIRED for gaze mapping, one could store that information here.
